channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: Favreau on 'Iron Man' armor and alcoholism
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: Comics
item.description:
"We're gonna have it take place in the present day, but there will be an origin story that has the old, gray Iron Man suit; eventually it will progress into more of the modern look," said 'Iron Man' director Jon Favreau. "That's the fun of doing the first one."
"The alcoholism doesn't come into play until later on in the story of Iron Man," he said. "[The comic] started off in the '60s, where it was about him as a successful manufacturer who developed this suit. Then, later, it spins off into that story about him fighting against himself.. Thanks to: comics2film.com
item.content:encoded:
"We're gonna have it take place in the present day, but there will be an origin story that has the old, gray Iron Man suit; eventually it will progress into more of the modern look," said 'Iron Man' director Jon Favreau. "That's the fun of doing the first one."

"The alcoholism doesn't come into play until later on in the story of Iron Man," he said. "[The comic] started off in the '60s, where it was about him as a successful manufacturer who developed this suit. Then, later, it spins off into that story about him fighting against himself..
Thanks to: comics2film.com

item.title: Samsung's 19-inch SyncMaster CX915BW and 20-inch CD203BW
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: Hardware
item.description: Samsung just announced two new SyncMaster wide-screen LCDs with the introduction of their 19-inch CX915BW and 20-inch CD203BW. We know that prices will range from about $440 to $570 for these "HD" panels and well, that's about all we know. Still, rest assured in your supremacy 'cause that's likely heaps more than that product model knows about the LCD she's so wistfully hawking. Hey, Bob Barker just called and he wants his copy of Vista back. Thanks to: Engadget
item.content:encoded:
Samsung just announced two new SyncMaster wide-screen LCDs with the introduction of their 19-inch CX915BW and 20-inch CD203BW. We know that prices will range from about $440 to $570 for these "HD" panels and well, that's about all we know. Still, rest assured in your supremacy 'cause that's likely heaps more than that product model knows about the LCD she's so wistfully hawking. Hey, Bob Barker just called and he wants his copy of Vista back.
Thanks to: Engadget

item.title: 'Blu-Ray is key for games,' says Sony's UK MD
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: Hardware
item.description: SCE UK boss Ray Maguire has dismissed suggestions that Sony is bullying gamers by forcing them to adopt its movie-playing technology with PlayStation 3 - claiming Blu-Ray is essential to the next-gen gaming experience. Thanks to: gamesindustry.biz
item.content:encoded:
SCE UK boss Ray Maguire has dismissed suggestions that Sony is bullying gamers by forcing them to adopt its movie-playing technology with PlayStation 3 - claiming Blu-Ray is essential to the next-gen gaming experience.
Thanks to: gamesindustry.biz

item.title: Outlook 2007 Gets SMS Integration
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: Software
item.description: While Outlook 2007 won't be receiving the same user interface overhaul as its fellow core Office applications, the e-mail and organization software will get a number of new features, including RSS integration and improved calendar sharing. Also on the docket: built-in SMS text messaging. Photos: View images of Outlook 2007 Thanks to: betanews.com
item.content:encoded:
While Outlook 2007 won't be receiving the same user interface overhaul as its fellow core Office applications, the e-mail and organization software will get a number of new features, including RSS integration and improved calendar sharing. Also on the docket: built-in SMS text messaging. Photos: View images of Outlook 2007
Thanks to: betanews.com

item.title: Ghost Rider Trailer
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: Comics
item.description:
The new Ghost Rider Trailer has hit the web... and I've got mixed feelings about it. On the one hand I really like the feel of the trailer. It's got the intensity to hook me and get me interested in the story. But on the other hand the look of Ghost Rider in the trailer looks REALLY cartoony. I'm mean bad bad bad.
The design of the character is fine, but he sorta stands out like a Hell's Angels version of Roger Rabbit. Oh well, decide for yourself.
You can see the Ghost Rider trailer here. Thanks for Jay for the heads up. Thanks to: themovieblog.com
item.content:encoded:
The new Ghost Rider Trailer has hit the web... and I've got mixed feelings about it. On the one hand I really like the feel of the trailer. It's got the intensity to hook me and get me interested in the story. But on the other hand the look of Ghost Rider in the trailer looks REALLY cartoony. I'm mean bad bad bad.

The design of the character is fine, but he sorta stands out like a Hell's Angels version of Roger Rabbit. Oh well, decide for yourself.

You can see the Ghost Rider trailer here. Thanks for Jay for the heads up.

Thanks to: themovieblog.com

item.title: Ghost Rider Teaser Trailers Hit!
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: Comics
item.description: Sony Pictures has unleashed the new domestic and international teaser trailers for Ghost Rider in QuickTime formats at Apple ! Written and directed by Mark Steven Johnson, and starring Nicolas Cage, the comic book adaptation will be released in theaters on February 16, 2007. Thanks to: comingsoon.net
item.content:encoded:
Sony Pictures has unleashed the new domestic and international teaser trailers for Ghost Rider in QuickTime formats at Apple ! Written and directed by Mark Steven Johnson, and starring Nicolas Cage, the comic book adaptation will be released in theaters on February 16, 2007.
Thanks to: comingsoon.net

item.title: Message to X3 Moviegoers
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: Comics
item.description: You're planning to see X-Men: The Last Stand this weekend, right? When the credits roll, when the audiences begins to filter out of the exits... keep your seat. Thanks to: comics2film.com
item.content:encoded:
You're planning to see X-Men: The Last Stand this weekend, right? When the credits roll, when the audiences begins to filter out of the exits... keep your seat.
Thanks to: comics2film.com

item.title: Battlefield 2 Patch 1.3 Changelog - Patch Today
item.dc:creator: andy (mailto:andy@gamerscircle.net)
item.dc:subject: PC Gaming
item.description:
EA just shot over the full changelog for the hotly anticipated Battlefield 2 1.3 patch, plus word that that the patch itself will be released later today:
NEW FEATURES
Air dropped vehicles: Squad members can now send a request up the chain of command for a vehicle to be dropped at their location. Co-op: Co-op Mode allows you to play Single Player levels on the Internet and LAN with both AI controlled bots and human players. Several new options have been created that will allow the server creator to modify how the bots behave in game. Number of Bots: This setting allows you to determine the total number of bots that will spawn in game. Bot Ratio: This setting allows you to determine the percentage of total bots that will spawn for each team. For example, setting this value to 25 means that 25% of the total bots will spawn in Team 1, and 75% in Team 2. Team 1 is always the MEC, Chinese, or their allies, while Team 2 is always the USA, EU, and their allies. Bot Difficulty: This setting determines the skill level of the bots. 10 is easiest, 100 is the most difficult. ; Default Kit Selection: The kit that you used last is remembered at the beginning of the round and between maps.
GENERAL BUG FIXES & GAMEPLAY TWEAKS
Fixed issues with remote console and linux server. Prevented ban list from being cleared in the event of a server crash. Fixed the bug where helicopters abandoned in the air would continue flying. Fixed issue with player not properly ranking up on servers where the continuously play. If the player joins a squad while dead, the player will not be able to use the squad leader as a spawn point until they have respawned once. Flag Capture bar now reacts accurately to players entering the capture radius. Fixed bug where friendly vehicles showed as valid targets. Friendly Vehicle lock: Lock-on weapons do not lock on to friendly vehicles. The box with an X through it will still appear, but a lock tone will not sound and then if fired, the missile will not track the friendly target. Fixed bug that altered mini map functionality. Adjusted missile count on BF2SF helicopters. Fixed bug with Special Forces rank names. Fixed repairing HUD for the engineer when in a vehicle. Adjusted award criteria. Fixed a client crash after entering 300 characters into the IP address using "connect to IP." Fixed a tech hang when creating a single player account from an offline account. Fixed crash when switching from BF2 to BF2:SF (or vice versa). Fixed a crash caused when a player is joining a map and another player logs into the same account. Fixed a Dragon Valley exploit. Fixed a bug on Zatar Wetlands where AA missiles would not lock onto oil towers. Fixed a bug that caused the Eurofighter explosion to appear as a Mig-29 wreckage. Armor Bar removed from occupied machinegun emplacements. Fixed a bug on Kubra Dam and Zatar Wetlands that caused enemy AA sites to not display in bombing HUD.
SPECIAL FORCES BUG FIXES & GAMEPLAY TWEAKS
Firing crossbow from open vehicle position causes others to see player weapon firing. Fixed Repair Hud for the engineer when in a vehicle and repairing a team mate vehicles. Fixed a bug on Strike at Karkand where players were able to get inside a building by Train Accident when FF is turned off. Fixed the commander toys on Wake Island 2007 so that the US can no longer disable the Chinese artillery. Fixed a bug in Zatar Wetlands 32 where commander assets were not being properly dropped to the location specified by the User.
Update: The patch is now available from FilePlant at File Planet
item.content:encoded:
EA just shot over the full changelog for the hotly anticipated Battlefield 2 1.3 patch, plus word that that the patch itself will be released later today:


NEW FEATURES

  • Air dropped vehicles: Squad members can now send a request up the chain of command for a vehicle to be dropped at their location.

  • Co-op: Co-op Mode allows you to play Single Player levels on the Internet and LAN with both AI controlled bots and human players. Several new options have been created that will allow the server creator to modify how the bots behave in game.

    • Number of Bots: This setting allows you to determine the total number of bots that will spawn in game.

    • Bot Ratio: This setting allows you to determine the percentage of total bots that will spawn for each team. For example, setting this value to 25 means that 25% of the total bots will spawn in Team 1, and 75% in Team 2. Team 1 is always the MEC, Chinese, or their allies, while Team 2 is always the USA, EU, and their allies.

    • Bot Difficulty: This setting determines the skill level of the bots. 10 is easiest, 100 is the most difficult. ;

    • Default Kit Selection: The kit that you used last is remembered at the beginning of the round and between maps.



    GENERAL BUG FIXES & GAMEPLAY TWEAKS

    • Fixed issues with remote console and linux server.

    • Prevented ban list from being cleared in the event of a server crash.

    • Fixed the bug where helicopters abandoned in the air would continue flying.

    • Fixed issue with player not properly ranking up on servers where the continuously play.

    • If the player joins a squad while dead, the player will not be able to use the squad leader as a spawn point until they have respawned once.

    • Flag Capture bar now reacts accurately to players entering the capture radius.

    • Fixed bug where friendly vehicles showed as valid targets.

    • Friendly Vehicle lock: Lock-on weapons do not lock on to friendly vehicles. The box with an X through it will still appear, but a lock tone will not sound and then if fired, the missile will not track the friendly target.

    • Fixed bug that altered mini map functionality.

    • Adjusted missile count on BF2SF helicopters.

    • Fixed bug with Special Forces rank names.

    • Fixed repairing HUD for the engineer when in a vehicle.

    • Adjusted award criteria.

    • Fixed a client crash after entering 300 characters into the IP address using "connect to IP."

    • Fixed a tech hang when creating a single player account from an offline account.

    • Fixed crash when switching from BF2 to BF2:SF (or vice versa).

    • Fixed a crash caused when a player is joining a map and another player logs into the same account.

    • Fixed a Dragon Valley exploit.

    • Fixed a bug on Zatar Wetlands where AA missiles would not lock onto oil towers.

    • Fixed a bug that caused the Eurofighter explosion to appear as a Mig-29 wreckage.

    • Armor Bar removed from occupied machinegun emplacements.

    • Fixed a bug on Kubra Dam and Zatar Wetlands that caused enemy AA sites to not display in bombing HUD.



    SPECIAL FORCES BUG FIXES & GAMEPLAY TWEAKS

    • Firing crossbow from open vehicle position causes others to see player weapon firing.

    • Fixed Repair Hud for the engineer when in a vehicle and repairing a team mate vehicles.

    • Fixed a bug on Strike at Karkand where players were able to get inside a building by Train Accident when FF is turned off.

    • Fixed the commander toys on Wake Island 2007 so that the US can no longer disable the Chinese artillery.

    • Fixed a bug in Zatar Wetlands 32 where commander assets were not being properly dropped to the location specified by the User.



    Update: The patch is now available from FilePlant at File Planet
